FeatureExtractorLibrary

Class Feature

  • java.lang.Object
    • FeatureExtractorLibrary.Feature

  • public class Feature
extends java.lang.Object
    Feature is the class that contains the different feature values; besides the constructors and getters it has a generateHeader function and an overloaded toString method.
    Since:
    23 ‎July, ‎2018

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int NUM_FEATURES 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Feature(double[] min, double[] avgAcceleration, double[] stdDev, double[] avgAbsDiff, double[] zeroCrossing, int noOfBins, double[] bins, java.lang.String userID)
      This constructor gets all the data in arrays grouped by the type of attribute to fill the Feature attributes.
      Feature(double[] data, java.lang.String userID, int noOfBins)
      This constructor gets all the data in an array and supposing that the order is correct fills the Feature attributes.
      Feature(double minX, double minY, double minZ, double minMag, double avgAccelerationX, double avgAccelerationY, double avgAccelerationZ, double avgAccelerationMag, double stdDevX, double stdDevY, double stdDevZ, double stdDevMag, double avgAbsDiffX, double avgAbsDiffY, double avgAbsDiffZ, double avgAbsDiffMag, double zeroCrossingX, double zeroCrossingY, double zeroCrossingZ, double[] binsX, double[] binsY, double[] binsZ, double[] binsMag, java.lang.String userID)
      This constructor gets all the data in separate parameters, one by one, until it reaches the histograms, which are passed through arrays; the number of bins is not needed, but the userID of the subject is needed to fill the Feature attributes.

        public static final int NUM_FEATURES

        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Feature

        public Feature(double[] data,
               java.lang.String userID,
               int noOfBins)
        This constructor gets all the data in an array and supposing that the order is correct fills the Feature attributes.
        Parameters:
        data - array containing all the data
        userID - subjects ID
        noOfBins - number of bins in every histogram
        Since:
        23 ‎July, ‎2018

      • Feature

        public Feature(double[] min,
               double[] avgAcceleration,
               double[] stdDev,
               double[] avgAbsDiff,
               double[] zeroCrossing,
               int noOfBins,
               double[] bins,
               java.lang.String userID)
        This constructor gets all the data in arrays grouped by the type of attribute to fill the Feature attributes.
        Parameters:
        min - array containing the minimum value on every axis and magnitude
        avgAcceleration - array containing the minimum value on every axis and magnitude
        stdDev - array containing the minimum value on every axis and magnitude
        avgAbsDiff - array containing the minimum value on every axis and magnitude
        zeroCrossing - array containing the minimum value on every axis
        noOfBins - number of bins in every histogram
        bins - array containing the histogram values
        userID - subjects ID
        Since:
        23 ‎July, ‎2018

      • Feature

        public Feature(double minX,
               double minY,
               double minZ,
               double minMag,
               double avgAccelerationX,
               double avgAccelerationY,
               double avgAccelerationZ,
               double avgAccelerationMag,
               double stdDevX,
               double stdDevY,
               double stdDevZ,
               double stdDevMag,
               double avgAbsDiffX,
               double avgAbsDiffY,
               double avgAbsDiffZ,
               double avgAbsDiffMag,
               double zeroCrossingX,
               double zeroCrossingY,
               double zeroCrossingZ,
               double[] binsX,
               double[] binsY,
               double[] binsZ,
               double[] binsMag,
               java.lang.String userID)
        This constructor gets all the data in separate parameters, one by one, until it reaches the histograms, which are passed through arrays; the number of bins is not needed, but the userID of the subject is needed to fill the Feature attributes.
        Parameters:
        minX - minimum value on axis X
        minY - minimum value on axis Y
        minZ - minimum value on axis Z
        minMag - minimum value on magnitude
        avgAccelerationX - average value on axis X
        avgAccelerationY - average value on axis Y
        avgAccelerationZ - average value on axis Z
        avgAccelerationMag - average value on magnitude
        stdDevX - standard deviation on axis X
        stdDevY - standard deviation on axis Y
        stdDevZ - standard deviation on axis Z
        stdDevMag - standard deviation on magnitude
        avgAbsDiffX - average absolute difference on axis X
        avgAbsDiffY - average absolute difference on axis Y
        avgAbsDiffZ - average absolute difference on axis Z
        avgAbsDiffMag - average absolute difference on magnitude
        zeroCrossingX - zero crossing on axis X
        zeroCrossingY - zero crossing on axis Y
        zeroCrossingZ - zero crossing on axis Z
        binsX - array containing the histogram values on axis X
        binsY - array containing the histogram values on axis Y
        binsZ - array containing the histogram values on axis Z
        binsMag - array containing the histogram values on magnitude
        userID - subjects ID
        Since:
        23 ‎July, ‎2018
